label: particle of sand
SYNONYMS: grain of sand|granule of sand|sand granule
definition: A particle which 1) is composed primarily of and derived from rock or mineral sources and 2) is or was part of a portion of sand.

label: particle of silt
definition: A particle which 1) is primarily composed of quartz or feldspar and 2) is or was part of a portion of silt.

label: soil
subClassOf [LABEL]: some clay| some mineral material| some organic material| some pedosphere| some sand| some silt| some water-holding capacity of soil|environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is primarily composed of minerals, varying proportions of sand, silt, and clay, organic material such as humus, interstitial gases, liquids, and a broad range of resident micro- and macroorganisms.

label: liquid water
definition: An environmental material primarily composed of dihydrogen oxide in its liquid form.

label: sediment
definition: Particulate environmental material which is formed as a result of the transport and deposition of particles by flowing liquid.

label: saline water
definition: Water which contains a significant concentration of dissolved salts.

label: fresh water
definition: Water which has a low concentration of dissolved solutes, particularly that of sodium chloride.

label: clay
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particle of clay|particulate environmental material
definition: Particulate environmental material which 1) is composed primarily of clay particles, with only minor proportions of other materials, 2) demonstrates plasticity when wet, and 3) is capable of hardening when dried or fired.

label: sterile water
definition: Sterile water is water which does not contain lliving organisms.

label: rhizosphere
definition: The narrow region of soil that is directly influenced by root secretions and associated soil microorganisms.

label: environmental material
definition: A material entity which other material entities in an environmental system are primarily or partially composed of.

label: silt
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particle of silt|particulate environmental material
definition: Particulate environmental material which is primarily composed of silt particles.

label: sand
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particle of sand|particulate environmental material
definition: Particulate environmental material which is composed primarily of particles of sand with only minor proportions of other substances.

label: particulate environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is composed primarily of particles.

label: organic material
definition: Environmental material derived from living organisms and composed primarily of one or more biomacromolecules.

label: environmental system
definition: A system which has the disposition to environ one or more material entities.

label: mineral material
definition: A mineral material is an environmental material which is primarily composed of some substance that is naturally occurring, solid and stable at room temperature, representable by a chemical formula, usually abiogenic, and that has an ordered atomic structure.

label: atmosphere
definition: An atmosphere is a layer of gases surrounding a material body of sufficient mass that is held in place by the gravity of the body.

label: layer
definition: A material entity which 1) is spatially continuous, 2) is composed of material of comparable thickness, composition, and physical properties, and 3) is physically distinct from adjacent portions of environmental material.

label: freshwater environment
definition: An aquatic environment which is determined by freshwater.

label: saline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by saline water.

label: aquatic environment
definition: An environment whose dynamics are strongly influenced by water.

label: outer space
definition: Outer space is a hard vacuum containing a low density of particles, predominantly a plasma of hydrogen and helium as well as electromagnetic radiation, magnetic fields, neutrinos, dust and cosmic rays that exists between celestial bodies.

label: planetary crust
definition: A planetary crust is the outermost solid shell of a rocky planet or natural satellite, which is chemically distinct from the underlying mantle.

label: planetary structural layer
definition: A planetary structural layer is laminar part of a terrestrial planet or other rocky body large enough to have differentiation by density. Planetary layers have differing physicochemical properties and composition.

label: lithosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some planetary crust| some solid environmental material|planetary structural layer
definition: A lithosphere is the outermost shell of a terrestrial-type planet or natural satellite that is defined by its rigid mechanical properties.

label: astronomical body
definition: An object which is naturally occuring, bound together by gravitational or electromagnetic forces, and surrounded by space.

label: planet
definition: A planet is an astronomical body orbiting a star or stellar remnant that is massive enough to be rounded by its own gravity, is not massive enough to cause thermonuclear fusion, and has cleared its neighbouring region of planetesimals.

label: astronomical object
subClassOf [LABEL]: some astronomical body| some geodiversity|surrounded by some outer space
definition: An object which is composed of one or more gravitationally bound structures that are associated with a position in space.

label: astronomical body part
definition: A material part of an astronomical body.

label: solid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a solid state.

label: liquid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is in a liquid state.

label: biosphere
definition: An astronomical body part which includes all the living entities within the gravitational sphere of influence of that body, as well as the non-living and dead entities with which they interact.

label: hydrosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some liquid water|liquid astronomical body part
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of the combined mass of water found on, under, and over the surface of a planet.

label: pedosphere
subClassOf [LABEL]: some atmosphere| some biosphere| some hydrosphere| some lithosphere| some soil|astronomical body part
definition: An astronomical body part which is composed of soil, subject to soil formation processes, and found on the surface of a lithosphere.

label: environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environmental system which is determined by materials bearing roughly homogeneous qualities.

label: rhizosphere environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some plant-associated environment| some rhizosphere|environmental system
definition: An environmental system determined by the presence of a plant rhizosphere.

label: environmental system determined by an organism
definition: An environmental system which is determined by a living organism.

label: plant-associated environment
definition: An environmental system determined by a green plant.

label: animal-associated environment
definition: An environmental system determined by an animal.

label: non-saline environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: environmental system determined by a quality

label: sediment permeated by freshwater
definition: Sediment which has its porespace filled by water which has very low levels of sodium chloride and/or other salts.

label: fecal environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by feces.

label: environment determined by a metazoan secretion
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a bodily secretion of a metazoan.

label: environment determined by a plant substance
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a substance produced by a plant.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a plant surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a plant.

label: digestive tract environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a digestive tract.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on an animal surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a animal.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a fungal surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on the surface of a fungus.

label: sediment permeated by saline water
definition: Sediment which has its porespace filled by water with increased levels of sodium chloride and other salts.

label: saline environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: environmental system determined by a quality
definition: An environment which is determined by materials which bear significant concentrations of salts.

label: fungi-associated environment
definition: An environmental system determined by a fungal structure.

label: sterile water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sterile water.

label: hypersaline water environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by hypersaline water.

label: soil environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by soil.

label: planetary subsurface environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by the subsurface zone of a planet.

label: non-saline planetary subsurface environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by those parts of a planetary subsurface zone which are not saline.

label: sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment.

label: non-saline sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment permeated by non-saline water.

label: saline sediment environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by sediment permeated by saline water.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a non-saline surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on a surface which is exposed to non-saline materials.

label: aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by an aerosol.

label: saline aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a saline aerosol.

label: non-saline aerosol environment
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by an aerosol with a low concentration of dissolved solutes.

label: environment associated with an animal part or small animal
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead animal, or a whole small animal.

label: environment determined by a biofilm on a saline surface
definition: An environmental system which has its properties and dynamics determined by a biofilm on a surface which is exposed to saline materials.

label: environment associated with a plant part or small plant
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead plant, or a whole small plant.

label: environment associated with a fungal tissue
definition: An environmental system determined by part of a living or dead fungus.

label: mock community culture
definition: A cell culture which is composed of a microbial community of known composition.

label: single strain cell culture
definition: A cell culture which is composed of a single population of bacterial or archaeal cells.

label: ecosystem
definition: An environmental system which includes both living and non-living components.

label: geodiversity
definition: A quality which inheres in a astronomical body or astronomical body part by virtue of the variation in its material composition, participation in geological processes, and the variation in is land- and hydroforms.

label: liquid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of liquid material.

label: fluid astronomical body part
definition: A part of an astronomical body which is primarily composed of fluid.

label: fluid layer
definition: A layer which is composed primarily of some fluid.

label: mass of environmental material
definition: An object which is composed primarily of an environmental material

label: mass of solid material
definition: An mass of environmental material which is composed primarily of a solid environmental material

label: water-holding capacity
definition: A disposition of a material entity which is realised when it is saturated with liquid water.

label: particle
subClassOf [LABEL]: some particulate environmental material|mass of solid material
definition: A mass of solid material which is either 1) a minute fragment of a larger mass or 2) one of a collection of small masses composing an aggregate.

label: particle of clay
definition: A particle which 1) is composed primarily of hydrous aluminium phyllosilicate minerals, in turn composed of aluminium and silicon ions bonded into tiny, thin plates by interconnecting oxygen and hydroxide ions, and 2) is or was part of a portion of clay.

label: cell culture
definition: A cell culture is a growth of cells in vitro in an artificial medium for experimental research.

label: fluid environmental material
definition: An environmental material which is unable to resist shear forces and continuously deforms when subject to them.

label: water-holding capacity of soil
definition: Water-holding capacity which inheres in some soil.

label: anatomical entity environment
subClassOf [LABEL]: some environmental system determined by an organism|environmental system
definition: An environment which is determined by an anatomical entity.
